title: 2018–19 Liverpool F.C. Women season
text: The <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20FA%20WSL">2018–19 season</a> is <a href="Liverpool%20F.C.%20Women">Liverpool Football Club Women</a>'s 30th season of competitive <a href="Association%20football">football</a> and its ninth season in the <a href="FA%20Women%27s%20Super%20League">FA Women's Super League</a> and at the top level of English women's football, being one of the league's foundation clubs. It is also its first season following a re-brand from its former name "Liverpool Ladies Football Club". <a href="Neil%20Redfearn">Neil Redfearn</a> replaced Scott Rogers as manager before the preseason. Redfearn joins the club after guiding <a href="Doncaster%20Rovers%20Belles">Doncaster Rovers Belles</a> to the crown of <a href="FA%20WSL%202">FA WSL 2</a> in the previous season. Redfearn resigned after three months and only two matches in charge, ending his tenure with a 5–0 loss to <a href="Arsenal%20W.F.C.">Arsenal</a> in the league's opening weekend.
